fields.description: Some teams have given the Jira Administrators permission to groups that might need that access in Jira, but not in Portfolio. The inability to restrict who gets the Portfolio Administrator permission can be a big problem for some teams, since not all Jira permissions will evenly translate into Portfolio permissions on all systems for all companies.
fields.summary: Customize Portfolio Administrators Permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the new experience does not support assignee availability due to Individual capacity planning being replaced by team capacity planning in the new experience: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/future-releases-and-limitations-953663163.html

h3. Suggested Solution

Support assignee availability in the new experience.
fields.summary: Support absences and exceptions of Assignee for the new experience

fields.description:
h1. +{color:#00875a}To resolve this issue please upgrade to version 76 or above of Chrome.{color}+
h3. Issue Summary

Changes in Chrome 75 resulted in a memory leak when viewing a Portfolio plan (using the new planning experience) which causes the browser to crash.
h3. Environment

Using Chrome browser version 75 or higher
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira
 # Go to a Portfolio plan that uses the new planning experience

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to use Portfolio without Chrome crashing.
h3. Actual Results

After a short period of time the browser crashes with "Aw, snap" error
h3. Workaround

Use a version of Chrome earlier than version 75 or use an alternative browser
fields.summary: Using Chrome 75 on Portfolio 3.x results in browser crash

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, Portfolio uses the default "Story Points" field created by Jira Software, this is not configurable. 

Software orgs may use a different field to estimate stories but this is not reflected in Portfolio. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Make the "Story Points" field in Jira Portfolio configurable. i.e. allow the Portfolio admin to choose which custom field to use to display story points in Portfolio. 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: As a Portfolio admin, I want to configure which Story Points field Portfolio uses for estimates

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, when using a webhook, the Jira Portfolio Team field returns the Team Name instead of its ID. Under certain scenarios, this is not desirable. 

h3. Suggestion
Allow the Team ID and Team Name to be sent separately.

(i) This was reproduced on Portfolio 3.x onwards. Previous versions did not present this behavior.
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio Team ID to be sent via webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the old UI, Team are able to use the Suggested Velocity feature to set the velocity. This is missing in the new UI: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-team-settings-802170547.html#Configuringteamsettings-Configuringteamvelocity

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the suggest velocity to the new experience.
fields.summary: Add Suggested Velocity to the new experience.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the old UI, Team are able to use the Suggested Velocity feature to set the velocity. This is missing in the new UI. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the suggest velocity to the new experience.
fields.summary: Add Suggested Velocity to the new experience.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently,  Original Story Points is not available in the new experience. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add this field to the new experience.
fields.summary: Add Original Story Points field to Portfolio new experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently based on the factors specified, the Portfolio Algorithm would schedule issues and hence change the start and end dates accordingly 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to be able to keep the dates manually inserted from being optimized
fields.summary: I would like the scheduler not to change the Start and End dates for items where Dates have already been specified.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating any tasks in new UX the Tempo Account dropdown does not allow you to search for needed account in 3.0.0

If you try same process using old UX in 3.0.0 it works as expected.

Account is a Tempo Field which displays a list of Tempo Account related to the Jira Project.
 We require this field on all Jira since to allow us to track time correctly to the correct IT Projects and support.

When adding a new Issue via portfolio, it prompts you for Tempo Account and you can search for correct accounts.  This was working in both old UX and New UX before 3.0.0.

It stopped working in new UX when upgraded to 3.0.0.
h3. Environment
 * *3.0+ New Experience/Interface*

 
h3. Expected Results

Can search Accounts within Account drop-down field
h3. Actual Results

Cannot search within Account drop-down field

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue with searching Tempo Account field in the 3.0+new interface

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new experience, Portfolio rolled up Story points of issues which are completed to parent Epic.


h3. Environment

Jira Portfolio 3.X.X


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a plan.
# Create an Epic in the plan.
# Create 2 Stories under the Epic.
# Ensure that the plan is using Story points as an estimate.
# Commit the changes to ensure that Epic and Stories are created.
# Add 5 Story points for each of the stories.
# Commit the changes.
# Complete 1 of the story.
# Under "Fit" besides the "View settings", click on "Show rolled-up values in fields".
# Edit the plan to exclude issues in "Done" status.

h3. Expected Results

Portfolio rolls up Story points of completed issue to Epic.


h3. Actual Results

Portfolio rolls up a total estimate of child issue to the parent Epic.


h3. Workaround

Switch to the old experience. In old experience, Portfolio rolls up the estimate of an incomplete issue to parent Epic when we exclude completed status from the plan.
fields.summary: Story points rolled incorrectly in new experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is not possible to configure and restrict the issues that are shown in the Parent Link field

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow this configuration therefore issues of a particular status would only show up here
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to restrict the Parent Link fields to Issues of a particular status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The 'Scheduled Start Date' of an Epic is not retaining the initial/first 'Sprint Start Date' of the the issues contained in the Epic.
h3. Environment
 * JPO 2+ (not including the 'new interface')

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up project with an Epic and issues, and link issues to the Epic
 # Create Sprint, and add a few issues to it (not all your issues)
 # Set up new Plan with this new Project
 # Start Sprint, and note the scheduled start date applied to the Epic in the Plan
 # Complete Sprint
 # Create new Sprint, and add issues
 # Start Sprint, and observe in plan this new Sprint Start Date is inherited by the Parent/Epic - overwriting the original Scheduled Start Date

  !Epic Scheduled Start Date.png|width=859,height=204!
h3. Expected Results

Oldest Sprint Start Date held as the Epic's Scheduled Start Date would be held and not overwritten.
h3. Actual Results

Newest Sprint Start date overwrites the Epic Scheduled Start Date

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Parent issue inherits Sprint start date as Scheduled Start Date every time a new Sprint is started containing issues in the Parent

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a user remove a Release option from plan view, Portfolio will automatically show the rest of the versions options rather than just removing the version from issue.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Add 2 version to the issue source of the plan.
# Ensure that an issue in the plan has a version.
# Remove the version from the issue (from plan) and Portfolio will immediately show the rest of the version options rather than just removing the version.


h3. Suggested Solution

Make Portfolio to just remove the Version name and prevent the dialog which displays rest of the Version from showing up.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Clear Release option in plan view

fields.description: We would like to be able to print our plans to PDF, XLS, CSV, etc
fields.summary: Add a Print Option

fields.description:
Currently, Portfolio for Jira Server & Data Center are compatible up to Jira 8.1.X.

Needed: Add compatibility with Jira 8.2.X
fields.summary: Portfolio for Jira Server/DC compatibility with Jira 8.2

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Portfolio allows [Grouping Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/grouping-issues-968677305.html] by assignee, projects, components, and teams. Allowing Portfolio to Group by any custom field would provide flexibility when grouping issues into separate swim lanes.  

h3. Suggested Solution
* Expand this grouping capability to Group by any custom field.
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio to Group by any custom field

fields.description:
*Example/User Story:*


I create Filters for different Projects and build a Plan using 3 filters as Input.

I now need to use a 4th Filter to add Sources to that Plan., as a "what if" scenario. So what I would like to do is Save the Plan that has the 3 filters as a Scenario, and then in an additional Scenario - Add Sources to the Plan and then decide if I want to use it.

Scenarios do not work in this situation, due that each one is using the same Issue Source configuration.
fields.summary: Allow Scenarios to include individual Issue Source configurations.

fields.description:
Currently, the plan gets Scheduled as per scheduling algorithms which accounts for many factors like rank, dependancies between work items in backlog , team capacity 

Customer would like to have a feature where the issues in plan can only be scheduled according to release dates
fields.summary: Schedule issues in the plan only based on release dates

fields.description: For example if an estimated effort is 10 hours per issue abc-123 when I'm assigning two team members to this issue you'd be able to assign 2 hours to person A and 8 hours to person B
fields.summary: Allow the ability to split custom amounts of time across team members in plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue on the schedule has a dependency on one or many others, the bubble with the number of dependencies is not showing on the right side of the bar.
h3. Environment
This problem only impacts the new experience of Portfolio.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two issue links:
||Name||Outward Description||Inward Description||
|Blocks|blocks|is blocked by|
|Depends on|depends on|is a dependency for|
# Create two dependencies in Portfolio:
** If A blocks B then A is scheduled before B
** If A depends on B then B is scheduled before A. 
Note the second dependency has the issue link *swapped* (B is scheduled before A).
# Create 4 issues and add them to a plan:
** T-1 blocks T-2
** T-2 is blocked by T-1
** T-3 is a dependency for T-4
** T-4 depends on T-3
# Auto-schedule your plan.

h3. Expected Results
The bubbles with the number of dependencies will show correctly in the schedule.
!portfolio_correct_bubbles.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
For the swapped link (Dependency), bubbles are swapped too. They appear on the wrong side of the bar.
!portfolio_bubbles.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
* If possible, try not use swapped links when setting Portfolio dependencies. This may require that you change your issue links in the Jira admin and delete all the links for existing issues the re-create them. 
* Or, use the old interface. 

Currently there is no other known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Bubbles showing the number of dependencies in the schedule are on the wrong side of the bar

fields.description:
Currently, if the issue is stretched through multiple sprints then sprint capacity calculation is spreading the issue estimate evenly across sprints.


This is not consistent with Auto-schedule results. If the issue is estimated and scheduled for multiple sprints then Auto-schedule provides *load* value for each sprint to explicitly assign story points/hours per each sprint.

The above inconsistency may lead to sprints marked as overbooked.


h4. Steps to reproduce
 - create a plan based on scrum project with sprints defined
 - keep the empty team with default 30 story points velocity
 - create two epics estimated both for 21 story points
 - Auto-schedule

h4. Problem
 - The first sprint is marked as overbooked with 31sp assigned.
 - But according to Auto-schedule first sprint is not overbooked as it distributes 21sp from the second epic unevenly. 9sp goes to the first sprint. 12sp goes to the second sprint.

h4. Workaround
You should ignore the preview mode of the auto-scheduler because it's inaccurate. 
Instead, you should accept the auto-scheduler changes and review them in team capacity graph. If you're unhappy, revert them.
fields.summary: Sprint capacity calculation not consistent with Auto-schedule load

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Portfolio uses its own Date/Time Formats. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Portfolio to use the format specified in Jira's Look and feel
fields.summary: Portfolio to follow Date/Time Formats of Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in the new experiance, it is not possible to specify the timezone for the plan. In the old UI, this is possible through the timezone configuration. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the timezone configuration in the new UI.
fields.summary: Implement Plan Timezone in the new experience

fields.description:
h3. Rank of an Epic does not get set Properly
h3. Environment

Portfolio for Jira 2.X
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a set of Epics with child issues;
 # Configure dependencies between stories and their parent Epics;
 # Assuming Epic E1 is on top and E2 is under, moving E1 over E2 causes the UI to show E1's group on top of E2;
 # Refresh, commit or run a "blank" search;

h3. Expected Results

E1 and its children stay on top of E2.
h3. Actual Results

E1 is moved underneath E2 again as if no changes were performed.

 
h3. Workaround

For now, the known workaround is to move one of the children of E1 above E2, that will cause E1 and its group to also be moved on top and changes will persist. The reason is that in 2.0, Epics are dependant on their children issues' rankings, so these changes are required to be made to children issues first.
fields.summary: Rank of an Epic does not get set properly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to specify the default Issue Type or order the issues types, when creating the issues from within Portfolio inline issue create. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow admins to be able to configure the default Issue Type and specify the order too.
fields.summary: As a Advanced Roadmaps admin, I would like to be able to specify the default or the order of Issue Type in the Advanced Roadmaps Inline issue create

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira Due dates and Portfolio Target due dates are separate fields, and you need to manually change the dates in both applications

h3. Suggested Solution

Make a sync possible as already implemented in Portfolio Cloud: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/configuring-the-target-due-date-field-958453951.html
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I would like to sync our Jira Due dates with Target due dates in Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Scrolling up and down on new experience plan show some delay in rendering the items (it shows blank white space for 1.5 seconds before populating it with the list of items)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Load the plan (lets say with 100 issues)
# Enable new experience
# Scroll up and down

h3. Expected Results
It will go smoothly, showing the list of items in no time, just like in previous plan mode

h3. Actual Results
it shows some delay in rendering the items (it shows blank white space for 1.5 seconds before populating it with the list of items)

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Scrolling up and down on new experience plan has delay

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Not possible to set Cross releases using Bulk settings in the plan
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Cross Project Release
 # In the scope section, select the *checkboxes* for the corresponding issues.
 # Click the *Bulk actions* menu > *Release*. The Bulk actions dialog will be displayed.

h3. Expected Result

It is possible to select Cross Project releases from the dropdown

h3. Actual Results

The dropdown doesn't allow you to select  Cross Project releases.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not possible to set Cross releases using Bulk settings in the plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Portfolio Team avatars are rendered incorrectly in the {{Filter Results}} gadget imported from Jira to Confluence.

h3. Environment
Any Confluence or Jira versions, with Jira Portfolio installed to Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import the {{Filter Result}} gadget from Jira to Confluence
# Place the {{Filter Result}} macro on a Confluence page, and select a filter
# Add the {{Team}} column to the macro
# Save the page and view the result

h3. Expected Results
The Team avatar should appear as a single line entry the same size as the team name.

h3. Actual Results
The Team avatar is shown at its full native size
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Upgrade to Jira Portfolio 2.27.0 or later.

Note that this removes team avatars from the filter view entirely, thus resolving the issue.
fields.summary: Portfolio team avatars are rendered incorrectly in Filter Result gadget

fields.description:
Some of our teams have been looking for more control over the hierarchy used in Portfolio. Since Portfolio only have one hierarchy that is configured by system administrators we have some teams that are finding it hard to align all of their issues to what we have defined for them. While the hierarchy would broadly, there are many use cases where it does not.

Users are also looking for more control over how they can filter the graphical display of the issues within a plan so they can use things like JQL to search for specific issues which meet specific criteria and then see them in the display in Portfolio. So instead of using the filters to limit the issues to a specific item in the hierarchy and then filter on a release, they want to be able to search within Portfolio with something like this: “issuetype = Initiative And release = 2.13 AND linked issue in hasLinkedSR(1-12345) AND status != Resolved and group = TeamA”.
fields.summary: Enhance Portfolio to Support Additional Hierarchy and Filtering Capabilities

fields.description:
Hi, 

Request you to support us to add measure and track our project success using 'Workstream' filed in the Jira as a criteria to configure our boards. 

Currently we cannot see 'Workstream' in our Jira portfolio which is creating some confusion to use out Jira Portfolio effectively.

After all, we love to simplify things for our people.

Please advice.

 

Thank you,

 

Ashok Kumar J
fields.summary: Need our JIRA Project Portfolio to be measured using 'Workstream' field in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the old experience, we are able to restrict the start date of an issue from after a certain date using the "Earliest Start Date" field in the scope table. Currently, this is not available in the new experience. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the  "Earliest Start Date" field to the new experience.
fields.summary: Bring back "Earliest Start Date" to the new experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently Individual capacity planning is not available in the new experience. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement this feature to the new experience, including team member availability.
fields.summary: Implement Individual capacity planning in the new experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some Portfolio related plugins show as Unknown in Jira Update Check.

h3. Environment
Jira 8.0.2
Portfolio 3.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira 8.0.2.
# Install Portfolio 3.0.0
# Navigate to Jira Update Check and check compatibility for Jira 8.1.0

h3. Expected Results
Portfolio and it's related add-ons to show as "Compatible" as there is a compatible version for Jira 8.1.0.

h3. Actual Results
The following Portfolio related plugins show as "Unknown":
* Portfolio plans
* Portfolio Team Management
* querydsl-4.0.7-provider-plugin

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Running upgrade check on Jira shows some Portfolio plugin as "Unknown"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Portfolio Documentation is missing details from the "Changes in the improved interface" documentation for the new experience page, viewable here:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/changes-in-the-new-experience-961780550.html
 
Missing details on the Epic Progress indicators, the feature highlighted in 2.0 live plans here:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/tracking-progress-and-status-814212695.html 

We are tracking this one as a feature request at the following link, But the info needs to be on the changes page so we can get the info out appropriately to avoide causing confusion to customers testing out the functionality in the new experience:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-2547

h3. Suggested Solution
Let's get this updated to note the difference in Epic Progress in 2.X and 3.X

h3. Workaround
To enable the Epic Progress field you will need to disable the new experience and recalculate the plan
fields.summary: Changes in the improved interface article missing details on Epic Progress field
Update Configuring team setting documentation

fields.description:
Our team would like to use Epics in 2 different ways.  But having a dual definition is not helpful for us.  It would be helpful to be able to create an Epic 'like' card (with all of the functionality), but not have it called an Epic.

Note: You also mention "Stories, Themes and Initiatives" in your help, but you have no ability to create those 'type' of things, (other than using labels).

Thanks
fields.summary: Epic like Card type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Disabling 'give feedback' in portfolio is not an option. There was a system wide dark feature in previous versions to disable the 'give feedback' button: 
* {code:xml}
com.atlassian.portfolio.feedback.FeedbackButton.disabled
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to https://<your JIRA URL>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa as an Admin
# Add {code:xml}
add com.atlassian.portfolio.feedback.FeedbackButton.disabled
{code} in the "Enable dark feature" field

h3. Expected Results
The "give feedback button" is disabled

h3. Actual Results
The "give feedback button" is still available
 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disabling 'give feedback' in portfolio is not an option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Capacity in Portfolio show red bar while 100% utilized using Hours as estimation

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use hours as estimation for the plan
# Maximize the capacity for the sprint to 100%

h3. Expected Results

The capacity should show as 100% utilized and should be green. 

h3. Actual Results

The capacity shows as 100% utilized but is highlighted as red. 
 
h3. Notes

This works correctly is story points are used. Therefore if 100% story point is utilized then it shows up as green. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Capacity in Portfolio show red bar while 100% utilized using Hours as estimation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Auto-scheduling of team members/assignees is not currently implemented in the new experience. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement this for the new experience.
fields.summary: Team members and auto-scheduling

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is not possible to transition an issue from within the plan. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow issues to be transitions from within the plan.
fields.summary: As a portfolio user, I would like to be able to transition issues from the plan itself

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user edits the capacity of the plan, Portfolio displays incorrect data in roadmap.

+Steps to reproduce+

* Create a new Kanban board with a new project.
* Create an Epic and a Story in the board/Project.
* Create a version in the new board.
* Add the Story to the new version and the Epic.
* Edit the screen used by the project to add *Time Tracking* field.
* Edit the story and set the Original Estimate to 2 days.
* Create a new Portfolio plan.
* Set the Capacity to 10 hours during plan creation.
* Click on Auto-schedule.
* Under Roadmap, the Epic and Story will be shown with identical duration.
* Click on "Review changes" and save the changes.
* Change the capacity planning of the plan to 20 hours.
* Click on Auto-schedule.
* Check the roadmap and the Stories's duration will be shortened but the Epic's duration will remain the same.


h3. Environment

Jira Portfolio 3.0.0


h3. Expected Results

The duration of the Story under the Epic matches the duration of the Epic.


h3. Actual Results

The duration of the Story under the Epic does not matches the duration of the Epic.


h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Auto-schedule shows incorrect roapmap after capacity change

fields.description:
Portfolio V3.0 redesigned planning interface is easy to schedule and plan but it didn't show the progress of the task.

I suggest adding progress info into schedule bar.
fields.summary: Add progress info in Redesigned planning interface schedule bar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is not possible to configure the plan to start a task when all issues from a particular version have reached a certain status

h3. Suggested Solution

The abilityto specify that the particular task should start when all other with the same version will achieve the chosen status.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I want to be able to specify that the particular task should start when all other with the same version will achieve the chosen status.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the Progress column is available in the old experience and not in the new experience. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Include this in the new experience. 

h3. Why this is important
 
Allows you to see the progress of an issue.
fields.summary: Add Progress column to the new experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, you cannot add the Original Estimate field to the new experience. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add this field to the new experience. 
h3. Workaround
* Create a new scripted custom field to copy the value from the Original Estimate field in Jira time tracking and display in Portfolio
; or
* Use the old interface
; or
* Hover the issue in Portfolio to see an overview of the time estimates and logged time. 
!jpo_hover_issue_time.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add Original Estimate to Advanced Roadmaps New Experience

fields.description:
We appear to have a problem that after upgrading we can hit issues from changes to our local storage data structure. The most recent example of this was found when upgraded to the first 3.0.0 release candidate (I also subsequently hit this problem).

It occurred when I attempted to "Group by Component" - a bummer was shown and then the plan failed to load. The problem was resolved by clearing local storage but this is an unacceptable workaround for customers.

We need to look into our use of local storage and make sure we defensively code against it in case of unexpected changes. The bare minimum for this is to ensure upgrading from 2.27.0 does not break when using group by component but we should try to establish a safer pattern and see if we can avoid hitting this issues in the future.

Screenshot 

!Screen Shot 2019-03-27 at 8.16.26 am.png!

I think that this is a similar issue that I saw during a recent team demo - so I'm attaching the screenshot of that error as well.

!Screen Shot 2019-03-22 at 3.23.52 pm.png|width=1540,height=259!
fields.summary: Upgrading version causes bummer and white screen of death

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Go to add a custom field (this is particularly noticeable on Bulldog - see attached GIF and video
 * When the modal dialog is displayed you can scroll it off the screen
 ** When you have a mouse plugged in you get additional scroll bars both on the inner and outer content - there should only be one

Additional problems:
 * Long, unbroken custom field names should show an ellipsis but instead they cause horizontal scrolling
 * Wrapped custom field names (with spaces) cause the checkbox to be hidden beneath the wrapped content

Both are shown in the video and GIF

!Custom field scrolling issue.gif|width=1036,height=606!

fields.description:
It has been reported that on the Monsters Plan on Bulldog ([https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/secure/PortfolioPlanView.jspa?id=227&sid=251#plan/backlog]) that target start and end dates implied from sprint assignment are showing up as '01/Jan/1970' (see screenshot).

!Portfolio Issue.PNG|width=637,height=365!

This appears to be the result of the sprints not being available in the plan (which can be seen by attempting to assign a sprint to an issue).

On inspection of the plan I could see that there was no board that was included in the plan and the only team in the plan was a Kanban team (rather than a scrum team). I did attempt to add the board that included the sprints to the issue sources but still couldn't get the correct sprints to appear.

We need to:
 * Find the exact test case that causes sprints not to be loaded
 * Handle missing sprints better when rendering attempting to parse implicit dates

This issue should be fixed for the 3.0 GA.
fields.summary: Implied sprint dates show as 01/Jan/1970 when sprints are unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Before JPO 3, there is *Working hours and days* configuration on each plan:
!image-2019-04-16-17-19-50-731.png|thumbnail!
On JPO 3, the feature has been removed and documented in [Changes in the improved interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/changes-in-the-new-experience-961780550.html]:
{quote}
The following settings from Portfolio for Jira live plans are also used as default:
* Working hours and days
** Region: System default
** Work day: 8 hours
** Work week: Monday through Friday
{quote}
Due to this feature being removed, all the stories' estimation will be inconsistent between JIRA Software boards and JPO plans:
* On boards:
!image-2019-04-16-17-21-17-298.png|thumbnail! 
** WGR-1 and WGR-5 estimation is 2d 1h.
** WGR-3 and WGR-4 estimation is 2d.
* On JPO plan:
!image-2019-04-16-17-22-30-901.png|thumbnail!
** WGR-1 and WGR-5 estimation is 2d.
** WGR-3 and WGR-4 estimation is 1.875d.
* Time tracking settings on JIRA:
!image-2019-04-16-17-22-49-583.png|thumbnail!

The reason why WGR-1 and WGR-5 estimation is 2d 1h - this was updated from JPO plan and it is not respecting the time tracking time estimation and it is using 8 hours per day setting.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please add the existing feature which takes account the global time tracking settings for JPO stories estimation.

(i) This feature is not a part of [Future releases and limitations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/future-releases-and-limitations-953663163.html].

h3. Workaround
For a better visibility for the estimation values, we can configure JIRA time tracking to show in hours (this is under Administration > Issues > Time tracking):
{quote}
Time estimates will be displayed in the following format: *hours*
{quote}
and the JPO plan to show in hours as well (this is under Configure plan > Scheduling):
{quote}
Estimate issues in hours.
{quote}
fields.summary: Stories' estimation inconsistent due to features being removed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JQL function {{issuekey in childIssuesOf()}} is seems to be very expensive when dealing with larger result sets and will easily take up to if not over 2 seconds to finish for a single parent key if the customer uses multiple {{childIssuesOf()}} functions within a single JQL filter the search will take over 10 seconds which can lead to some problematic behavior.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link 200 issues to a single initiative.
# Search for the child issues of the initiative.

h3. Notes
If you capture the behavior within a HAR file you may see a {{jqlTooComplex}} error, however this appears to be a false error as the results are still displayed correctly.

h3.Workaround
Currently no workaround known.
fields.summary: The childIssuesOf JQL function is slow when dealing with larger result sets.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Customers who have Parent/Child issues using a Custom Portfolio Hierarchy do not see the same visual formatting applied to issues that have been resolved
h3. Suggested Solution

Match Visual Strikethrough formatting that is applied to issues linked when an Issue is closed:
h3. Why this is important

Visually, when an issue is struck through, we can quickly see that the issue is resolved, however as there is no visual formatting nor status indicator, Customers would need to click through to see the status of the Child Issue
h3. Workaround

Link Child Issues to their Hierarchal Parent
fields.summary: Child Issues Should Appear Strikethrough on Parent

fields.description:

Currently, when the user clicked on Releases, they can only select versions configured for the projects. Portfolio has [later release|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/using-the-later-release-802170570.html] which is used to schedule issues without versions. 

Users would like another option in the Releases filter (Eg: Empty Version) to display all issues without versions in the scope view.

 !Screenshot 2019-04-04 at 10.54.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution

Add another filter option Eg: Empty Version) to display all issues without versions in the scope view.


h3. Workaround 

None.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot prioritize Epics in Portfolio Plan view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open up a Portfolio plan
# Create a few Epics
# Try to re-rank them in the plan view
# Commit your changes

h3. Environment

Portfolio 2.25 and 2.26

h3. Expected Results

The Epic should stay where it was placed in the Plan view. For example, moving it from 25 to 8 in the plan view should keep its rank. 

h3. Actual Results

The Epic goes back to its original ranking before you moved it in the Plan and committed the changes.

h3. Workaround

None. Upgrading to 2.27 fixes the problem and its no longer reproducible
fields.summary: Cannot prioritize Epics in Portfolio Plan view

fields.description:
The scheduling configuration for the minimum work package size above the on epic level or above is not correctly working. This concerns the schedule calculation of estimates put directly on epics or issues above the epic hierarchy level.

Reproduce:
Consider the following plan setup:
* one team with a velocity of 30 points
* two epics with an estimate of 29 points
* Minimum work package size 5 points

result: epic1 is scheduled completely in the first sprint, epic2 has one point scheduled in the first sprint and 28 in the second

expected result: epic 1 is scheduled completely in the first sprint, epic2 is scheduled completely in the second sprint

Only if the minimum work package size is set to a value smaller of equal 1 should the first result occur.
fields.summary: 'Minimum work package size' scheduling option is not respected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Enabling DEBUG on {{com.atlassian.rm.jpo.issueloading.lucene.issue.querying.explanation}} will have each "Issue sources" diplayed for a particular Plan.

It is impossible to correctly associate the "Issue Source" seen by Portfolio to the respective Issue Source JQL/filter/board/project used in the UI perspective - by just looking at the logs.

Example: UI view
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
(project = PLUTO AND issuetype in (Bug, Story, Sub-Task) AND Team = "Planet" OR project = PLUTO AND issuetype in (Epic)) AND (resolved is EMPTY OR resolved >= -90d) ORDER BY Rank ASC

(project = VENUS AND issuetype in (Bug, Story, Sub-Task) AND Team = "Planet" OR project = VENUS AND issuetype in (Epic)) AND (resolved is EMPTY OR resolved >= -90d) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

Example: logs
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
2019-03-11 20:13:25,054 http-nio-localhost-8080-exec-159 url:/jira/rest/jpo/1.0/backlog DEBUG user 1213x111111x1 xxxxx localhost /rest/jpo/1.0/backlog [c.a.r.j.i.l.i.querying.explanation.DefaultIssueLuceneExplainerFactory] Issue Source Query: +((+projid:20600 +(type:1 type:10001 type:5) +customfield_11500:57901) (+projid:20600 +type:10000)) +((-nonemptyfieldids:resolutiondate +visiblefieldids:resolutiondate) resolutiondate

2019-03-11 20:13:25,304 http-nio-localhost-8080-exec-159 url:/jira/rest/jpo/1.0/backlog DEBUG user 1213x111111x1 xxxxx localhost /rest/jpo/1.0/backlog [c.a.r.j.i.l.i.querying.explanation.DefaultIssueLuceneExplainerFactory] Issue Source Query: +((+projid:14906 +(type:1 type:10001 type:5) +customfield_11500:52515) (+projid:14906 +type:10000)) +((-nonemptyfieldids:resolutiondate +visiblefieldids:resolutiondate) resolutiondate
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Have additional logging to associate the "Issue Source" to its respective JQL/filter ID/board ID/project ID.

h3. Why this is important
The association would easily help in identifying the slow query used in a particular Plan from multiple Issue Sources used.
fields.summary: Improve logging for Issue sources query

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results
The Plan does not query massive documents, eg. 27,000 documents.

h3. Actual Results
We see 20+k documents pulled in:
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
2019-03-11 20:31:02,942 http-nio-localhost-8080-exec-302 url:/jira/rest/jpo/1.0/backlog username:user DEBUG user 111x111x1 xxxxxxxx IPaddress1 /rest/jpo/1.0/backlog [c.a.r.j.i.l.i.querying.explanation.DefaultIssueLuceneExplainerFactory] Query Explainer contents for request t1758309
    +(projid:20600 projid:14906 projid:25402) +(issue_security_level:-1) -> [21373 documents]
{code}

fields.description:
*Summary*
At this moment, we do not have a good alignment between the Portfolio global permissions and Plan level permissions. For example, if a user has the Edit permission for a plan, but does not have the Portfolio User general permission, then they will not be able to edit the plan.

*Suggestion*
We need a Portfolio create/edit/view plans permission so that it is clear to the user what permission is being given to the user.
fields.summary: As an admin, I need a separate create/edit/view plans permission group

fields.description: Some teams need to have other members of the organization review changes prior to committing those changes, and those members might not be Jira Users. The ability to export and share these changes would be preferable in this situation. The ability to export to CSV or other methods is suggested.
fields.summary: Export Review Changes prior to commit

fields.description:
Currently, a user needs to have the portfolio User view permissions in order to view the Child Issues (i.e. Epics) inside an Initiative in Jira.

We do not want to give all users the ability to create, view, and edit plans in Portfolio.  So the majority of our users have the Portfolio Restricted Access or the Portfolio Viewer Access.  We would like those users to also be able to view Child Issues in Jira.  So when in an Initiative in Jira they can also view the list of child Epics for that Initiative under the Child Issues.  

We currently allow parent links to be exposed without permissions, we should do the same thing with child issues.
fields.summary: Allow Those with Restricted or Viewer Access in Portfolio to View Child Issues in Jira

fields.description: We are already using a field called "Team Name" that is baked into our scrum board filters and workflows.  We want to start using Portfolio but refactoring how we are using this field would be an impediment to adoption.  It would be great if, as a Jira administrator, I could configure Portfolio to use my existing Team Name field, rather automatically creating the new field called Team.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Administrator to designate the Team field

fields.description:
*Summary:* 
After creating a new issue type for a new hierarchy level on Portfolio, e.g.:
 * Initiative
 * Epic
 * Story

When filtering for "Epic" or "Story", items with the "Initiative" issue type still appear in the plan view.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Create a new issue type(e.g. "Initiative") and add it as the highest hierarchy level in Portfolio.
 # Create two new projects containing the "Initiative" issue type.
 # Create a plan in Portfolio with both projects created above.
 # Create an issue with the "Initiative" issue type.
 # Add the necessary data, story points so the issues appear in the plan.
 # Filter the plan to only show Epics.
 # Filter the plan to only show Stories.

*Expected Results:*
The plan view only shows items with the issue type selected in the filter, e.g. Epic only shows issues with the Epic issue type.

*Actual Results:*
The plan view continues to show the issue with the "Initiative" issue type regardless of the filter selected.

*Workaround*
The only way to filter the "Initiative" out of the plan view is to filter the project with that issue type out of it as well.

*Notes:*
Initially, this bug was seen happening with two hierarchy levels above epic and one of the projects used in the plan only contained the highest issue type in the hierarchy, but after some testing, we saw that the problem happens regardless of this scenario.
fields.summary: Filter on plan doesn't work for hierarchy levels above epic.

Jira Title: Jira
Jira Version: 8.0.0
Agile Version: 8.0.0-DAILY20190121095156
{code}

h3. Environment
* Jira 8 (tested in 8.0.0 and 8.0.1)
* 2.25.0
* [Timetracker|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211243/timetracker-time-tracking-reporting?hosting=server&tab=overview] (installed first)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira 8
# Install [Timetracker|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211243/timetracker-time-tracking-reporting?hosting=server&tab=overview]
# Install Portfolio 2.25.0
# Click *Portfolio > View Portfolio*
 
h3. Notes
This appears to be caused by the fact that [Timetracker|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211243/timetracker-time-tracking-reporting?hosting=server&tab=overview] also installs *Querydsl Support for JIRA Plugin*. It looks like Portfolio sees this other (incompatible) version of Querydsl and does not install the * querydsl-4.0.7-provider-plugin-1.2.jar* that it normally installs and requires.

When Portfolio is installed first, there appears to be no problem and both Querydsl versions live side-by-side without any issues.

h3.Workaround
As of right now, the only working workaround that we found is to,
# Shut down Jira
# Remove the {{jira-querydsl-support-2.0.0.jar}} file from {{[JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-home-directory-938847746.html]/plugins/installed-plugins}} 
# Start Jira
# Add {{querydsl-4.0.7-provider-plugin-1.2.jar}} to {{[JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-home-directory-938847746.html]/plugins/installed-plugins}} if it's missing (attaching to this ticket)
# Jira Portfolio should now work as expected
fields.summary: Installing Timetracker before Portfolio breaks Portfolio plan viewing

fields.description:
Looking at the HAR file and latest stack trace in it, it seems like in our PlanInformationProvider we:
 * Do an initial permission check via the EnvironmentPermissions annotation
 * Then get the plan information which has its own set of permission check

The first pass is here to give the user a proper 404/plan not found.

It would seem the current user set of permissions allows to go through the first part but fails the second one which should not happen.
fields.summary: Permission check fails

fields.description:
|Hello,

while trying Portfolio for Jira 2.25 sadly I realised that the feature "Stages and skills" has been removed. We were evaluating the feature and where lucky to find something that helps to schedule based on available ressources and there skills. Now even with out Kanban Optimization the tool is currently useless for us due to a strict working with the Waterfall method. Minimum we need Kanban Optimization as fast as possible.

Background:
We have 2 Stories. The tasks per Storie are i.e. Design, Code, Test. Design and Test ist User A and Code is User B. We want a automatic planning that allows for User 1: Design 1 -> Design 2 --> Test (after Code)...  and User 2 after Design 1: Code 1 -> Code 2.

The classic experience allowed this perfectly.

Thank you and best regards
Alexander|
fields.summary: Portfolio for Jira 2.25 Feedback

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking on _Filter_ menu on the Portfolio new experience results in a pop-up error. This only happens on Internet Explorer, the same operation on Google Chrome works perfectly fine.

h3. Environment
This will only happen on Internet Explorer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Portfolio new experience for an existing plan; [Enabling the new experience in a plan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/setting-up-the-new-experience-952623570.html#Settingupthenewexperience-Enablingthenewexperienceinaplan]
# Click on the _Filter_ on the Roadmap page.

h3. Expected Results
Filter dropdown menu shows as it works on Google Chrome.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is being thrown:
!error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
As per [MDN's compatibility table for {{element.closest}}|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/closest#Browser_compatibility], {{element.closest}} is not compatible with the Internet Explorer.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround on Internet Explorer since this is a limitation on the browser. As a workaround, please use Google Chrome/Mozilla Firefox.
fields.summary: Filter does not work on IE for Portfolio new experience

fields.description: In Portfolio when I'm creating new issues in the scope I'm able to choose a release, however In our case we assign the issues to an major release and to another specific one, however but we can only choose ONE release.
fields.summary: Add multiple releases per issue on the scope as PM

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Only the backspace key works to clear the Target start or target end date fields in the New Experiance

h3.Environment:
* Windows (Backspace)
* Mac (Left Delete)
* Portfolio Early Access New Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set focus to either the Target Start or Target End date field
# Use any of the following options to clear the field:
#* Delete Key (Right Delete on Mac)
#* Clear key (Mac external Keyboards)
#* Space key

h3. Expected Results
The field value is cleared

h3. Actual Results
None of the options noted above work to clear the field and only a Backspace (Left Delete on Mac) will clear the field
 
h3. Notes
All options noted above work to clear the values on Live plans
fields.summary: Delete options on date fields not working

fields.description: The suggestion is to have the option to sort the capacity chart by the last name or capacity allocation (under/over).
fields.summary: Ability to sort the capacity chart by allocation and name

fields.description:
Currently, when you make changes in a plan, you can either commit the changes or click on calculate/optimize to apply them in the plan.

The suggestion is to have a flag option to make JPO automatically calculate all changes made in the plan.
fields.summary: Option to make JPO auto-calculate all changes.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

In New experience, after running optimize when the changes are committed, the operation takes longer amount of time then usual. (number of changes getting committed are ~1500)

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Plan, with multiple boards as Issue sources.
# When you hit calculate, there are no changes to be reviewed in Plan
# Turn on New Experience, Click On Optimize 
# Click On Accept changes, you can see progress in % , this operation will be done quickly
# Post that, Click on Review changes
# Most of the changes are related to Target start and Target end dates, but when you verify new value and  current value it is identical. 
!Review_changes.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on Save selected changes in Jira, Progress is very slow  !Progress.png|thumbnail! 
# If you commit same changes with disabling New experience, the changes gets committed within few minutes.

h3.Expected Results
Changes should not take such long time to commit to Jira 

h3.Actual Results 
It takes hours for changes to commit in Jira 

h3.Workaround 
If you disable the new experience and then try the same operation, it gets completed within few minutes
fields.summary: changes from new experience are taking longer time to save in jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, only the following fields are available to be added to the plan: 

# Number field, where you can enter and update numerical values in a field
# Single-line text field, where you can enter text in a single-line field
# Single-select drop-down of configurable options, from which you can select a single option

Scripted Fields comes from the 3rd party addon Scriptrunner, and this cannot be included into the plan. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Scripted fields to be included into the plan.
fields.summary: I would like to be able to add scripted fields from ScriptRunner into the plan

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * Slow navigation to an issue from the Scope view of Portfolio

h5. Background
 * When viewing a JIRA Portfolio plan, a user may click an issue in the plan to see more details for the issue. The [issue detail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/using-scope-and-dependencies-826889279.html] appears inside of the JIRA Portfolio view and shows how the issue is related to other issues (parent/child, or dependencies).
 * When loading the issue details JIRA Portfolio performs a search for linked issues. This search can take an excessive amount of time and causes the issue detail view to be slow to open.
 ** In one example, opening the issue detail in JIRA Portfolio UI took 25 - 45 seconds.
 ** There is no delay when viewing the issue in the standard JIRA issue view.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 * Load a large JPO plan.
 ** The plan that reproduced the behavior had several issue links. 
 * Click on an issue from the Scope view after the plan has loaded.
 ** You can verify your issue relates to this bug by [inspecting network activity in chrome developer tools|https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/network/]. The REST endpoint "rest/jpo/1.0/issuelink/get" will take a disproportionate amount of time to load (25-45 seconds for example).

h5. Expected Behavior
 * Navigating to a single issue from a Portfolio Plan should not take a similar amount of time as the entire plan to load. 

h5. Actual Behavior
 * Navigating to an issue from a Portfolio Plan uses:
{code:xml}
rest/jpo/1.0/issuelink/get
{code}

 * This operation works to find all the issue links coming from Jira and merge that data with any issue links from scenario data in Portfolio. In this scenario that introduces an additional delay after the plan has loaded.

h5. Workaround
 * No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Slow navigation to an issue from the Scope view of Portfolio

fields.description:
It would be nice if Portfolio would throw an error when trying to add an user to a restricted plan as an editor if they are in a read only global group

currently it accepts the plan restriction without a peep.
fields.summary: Present an error if a user is added as an editor but is in a view only global group

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Users are unable to add users to the plan restrictions unless they are portfolio admin, if they go back to the old experience it works fine

Users are presented with a "no options" message: 

 

h2. Steps to reproduce 
login as a portfolio user
open a plan
configure a plan
select permissions
add an additional user
switch to the new experience
select permissions

h2. Expected Behavior
user should be able to add users to editors or viewers 

h2. Actual Behavior
The user is not able to add additional users, a no options error is presented

h2. Cause

looks like this call is getting a 403 for regular ole users:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h2.Workaround:
switch to the old experience
add the user
switch back to the new experience
fields.summary: Portfolio users are unable to add users to plan restrictions unless they are portfolio admins in the new experience

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Scheduling algorithm schedules an issue to sprint past date AND/OR to team without board association (to schedule as much work as possible as early as possible).

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Have set of issues in plan
!beforeold.png|thumbnail!
!beforenew.png|thumbnail!
# Have several teams, where one of them is not associated with any boards/projects
!team.png|thumbnail!
# Have an active sprint (start and end dates are past dates, but sprint isnt closed yet)
!sprint.png|thumbnail!
# Optimize/Calculate

h4. Expected Result
* Issue should be scheduled to the present date (today) or future date (tomorrow onwards)
* Issue should be assigned to team associated with the board

h4. Actual Results
The scheduling algorithm tries to schedule as many work as possible, as early as possible, which results in:
* Issues being scheduled to the past dates (or active sprints with past start and end dates)
* Issues being assigned to the team which is not associated with any boards.

!afterold.png|thumbnail!
!afternew.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
# Complete the active sprint in the past
# Delete the team that isn't associated to any boards/projects (in case of a private team) or remove it from the plan (in case of a shared team)
# Explicitly assign a team with an associated board/project to each affected issue
fields.summary: Scheduling algorithm in portfolio

fields.description: Currently, when you make the Team field from portfolio available in Jira Software and use it in JQL search the value from the field gets converted to a number. It shows the team name in the result set but when you export it to CSV it's saved as a number.
fields.summary: Make team field searchable by the team name.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When showing a custom field using the Date Picker in Portfolio > Scope, the date is incorrect. 

Ex: Field in JIRA Issue View shows 20/Feb/19, however in Portfolio the field shows as 19/Feb/19

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field using the Date Picker
# Associate with screens in your given project
# Create an issue and populate the custom field with a date value
# Import Project issues in Portfolio or Create new Epics in the Plan scope view
# Go to Configure > Custom Fields
# Add the newly added custom field
# View or Edit the field in any Epic in Portfolio > Scope view.

h3. Expected Results
The same date as shown in JIRA issue

h3. Actual Results
The value shown is off by one day

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Custom Field using Date Picker shows incorrect by one day in Portfolio

fields.description:
As discuessed with our TAM Marc Kilgus and Roy from the JPO Team, I will create this issues which is more or less a copy of JPOCLOUD-1927,as this feature would be very useful also for Portfolio Server.

When a new JIRA project is added to a plan in Portfolio it would be very useful to be able to add that plan's cross-project releases to the new project. 

 

At the moment you can only either delete the cross-project release and recreate it again with alle the Jira projects. This is of course a huge pain.  Or you could create a release in Jira in the new project (and probably name it the same) and then add it to the CPR in Portfolio. But this also has lots of drawbacks, as maintaining the CPRs centrally in the Portfolio Plan is what makes this feature useful.

A simple "add project" functionality within an existing CPR would be the solution.

!image-2019-02-19-12-50-15-602.png!
fields.summary: Adding projects to a cross-project release in a plan

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Portfolio plan sorting is not based on selected hierarchy or selected level

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Have portfolio hierarchy as follow
#* Program
#* Epic
#* Story
#* Subtask
# Have the order of issues as follow in issue navigator:
!initial.png|thumbnail!
Then the order on the plan at *Program Level* will be 
!intialplan.png|thumbnail!
# Change the order in issue navigator to be as follow:
!result.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected result
The order shown in plan at Program level should remain the same
* PL-1
* PL-2
* PL-3

h4. Actual Result
The order changes as follow
!resultplan.png|thumbnail!

We can see that the story SSPX-2 and SSPX-3 are listed above PL-1. These two issues (SSPX-2 and SSPX-3) are associated with PL-2 and PL-3 respectively. Due to this, the order in Plan changes to list PL-2 first above PL-1.

If it's only project PL being selected, the order will remain as 
* PL-1
* PL-2
* PL-3

But as soon as other projects are selected (in this case SSPX), the order changes (as shown in the screenshot above)

Portfolio should focus on the rank of items at the selected hierarchy/level. Since the selected level is Program (above Epic/Story/Subtask), the order should remain the same as long as PL-1, PL-2, and PL-3 order remains the same in issue navigator.
fields.summary: Portfolio plan sorting based on hierarchy

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While creating sub-tasks under Story in Portfolio plan and some field is set as required in the Field Configuration Scheme used by the issue, JIRA will show the incorrect issue create screen while committing the changes.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Set a field as required in Field Configuration. Eg: "Description".
# Ensure that the Field Configuration is used by the sub-task issue.
# Access a Portfolio plan.
# Switch to the "New Experience" in plan.
# Create a sub-task under a Story.
# Commit the changes.


h3. Environment

# JIRA 7.13.1
# JIRA Portfolio 2.24.0


h3. Expected Results

JIRA creates a sub-task when the change is committed.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows a create screen for different issue when the change is committed.


h3. Workaround

# Make all the fields in Field Configuration optional (For Portfolio new experience).
# Switch to the old experience.
fields.summary: JIRA links wrong issue creation page while creating issue from Portfolio

fields.description:
When setting up the issue sources for a new plan (or modifying them for an existing one), it is possible to pick and choose what releases should be imported to the plan. When only a subset of releases has been chosen, there should be an option that prevents Portfolio from automatically importing any new releases that may have been added to the source Jira project(s).

The current behaviour, where new releases are automatically imported to the plan, means that in some configurations the plan owners regularly need to go through the list of releases in Portfolio and exclude them from the plan. In these scenarios (large plans with plenty of issue sources and multiple plans including the same source Jira project(s)), this needs to be done several times a week. I can definitely see how the current behaviour is useful in several scenarios but sometimes it is not desirable to have new releases pop up in the plan automatically.
fields.summary: Possibility to choose if new releases should be automatically imported to plan
